member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CloudWatchDestination
member.summary: An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CloudWatchDestination.DimensionConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DimensionConfigurations.
An array of objects that define the dimensions to use when you send email events to Amazon CloudWatch.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
member.summary: An object that defines the dimension configuration to use when you send Amazon Pinpoint email events to Amazon CloudWatch.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.DefaultDimensionValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultDimensionValue.
The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you send an email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).
It can contain no more than 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.DimensionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DimensionName.
The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric. The name has to meet the following criteria:
It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).
It can contain no more than 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.DimensionValueSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DimensionValueSource.
The location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose messageTag. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email headers, choose emailHeader. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use link tags, choose linkTags.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Content
member.summary: An object that represents the content of the email, and optionally a character set specification.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Content.Charset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Charset.
The character set for the content. Because of the constraints of the SMTP protocol, Amazon Pinpoint uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text includes characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a character set. For example, you could specify UTF-8, ISO-8859-1, or Shift_JIS.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Content.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The content of the message itself.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination operation. Create an event destination. In Amazon Pinpoint, events include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. Event destinations are places that you can send information about these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.
A single configuration set can include more than one event destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest.ConfigurationSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationSetName.
The name of the configuration set that you want to add an event destination to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest.EventDestination
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventDestination.
An object that defines the event destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest.EventDestinationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventDestinationName.
A name that identifies the event destination within the configuration set.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateConfigurationSet operation. Create a configuration set. Configuration sets are groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send using Amazon Pinpoint. You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest.ConfigurationSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationSetName.
The name of the configuration set.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest.DeliveryOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliveryOptions.
An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send emails that you send using the configuration set.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest.ReputationOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReputationOptions.
An object that defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint collects reputation metrics for the emails that you send that use the configuration set.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest.SendingOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SendingOptions.
An object that defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint can send email that you send using the configuration set.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the configuration set.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest.TrackingOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrackingOptions.
An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails that you send using the configuration set.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDedicatedIpPoolRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateDedicatedIpPool operation. Create a new pool of dedicated IP addresses. A pool can include one or more dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account. You can associate a pool with a configuration set. When you send an email that uses that configuration set, Amazon Pinpoint sends it using only the IP addresses in the associated pool.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDedicatedIpPoolRequest.PoolName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PoolName.
The name of the dedicated IP pool.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDedicatedIpPoolRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An object that defines the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the pool.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDedicatedIpPoolResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateDeliverabilityTestReport operation. Create a new predictive inbox placement test. Predictive inbox placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be handled by various email providers around the world. When you perform a predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. Amazon Pinpoint then sends that message to special email addresses spread across several major email providers. After about 24 hours, the test is complete, and you can use the GetDeliverabilityTestReport operation to view the results of the test.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportRequest.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
The HTML body of the message that you sent when you performed the predictive inbox placement test.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportRequest.FromEmailAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FromEmailAddress.
The email address that the predictive inbox placement test email was sent from.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportRequest.ReportName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportName.
A unique name that helps you to identify the predictive inbox placement test when you retrieve the results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the predictive inbox placement test.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse
member.summary: Information about the predictive inbox placement test that you created.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse.DeliverabilityTestStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliverabilityTestStatus.
The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is IN_PROGRESS, then the predictive inbox placement test is currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is COMPLETE, then the test is finished, and you can use the GetDeliverabilityTestReport to view the results of the test.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse.ReportId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportId.
A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateEmailIdentity operation. Verifies an email identity for use with Amazon Pinpoint. In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you use when you send email. Before you can use an identity to send email with Amazon Pinpoint, you first have to verify it. By verifying an address, you demonstrate that you're the owner of the address, and that you've given Amazon Pinpoint permission to send email from the address.
When you verify an email address, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email to the address. Your email address is verified as soon as you follow the link in the verification email.
When you verify a domain, this operation provides a set of DKIM tokens, which you can convert into CNAME tokens. You add these CNAME tokens to the DNS configuration for your domain. Your domain is verified when Amazon Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your domain. It usually takes around 72 hours to complete the domain verification process.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityRequest.EmailIdentity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailIdentity.
The email address or domain that you want to verify.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the email identity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityResponse
member.summary:
If the email identity is a domain, this object contains tokens that you can use to create a set of CNAME records. To sucessfully verify your domain, you have to add these records to the DNS configuration for your domain.
If the email identity is an email address, this object is empty.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityResponse.DkimAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DkimAttributes.
An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the identity. This object includes the tokens that you use to create the CNAME records that are required to complete the DKIM verification process.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityResponse.IdentityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityType.
The email identity type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityResponse.VerifiedForSendingStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerifiedForSendingStatus.
Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint, you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For more information about verifying identities, see the Amazon Pinpoint User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DailyVolume
member.summary: An object that contains information about the volume of email sent on each day of the analysis period.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DailyVolume.DomainIspPlacements
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainIspPlacements.
An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DailyVolume.StartDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartDate.
The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DailyVolume.VolumeStatistics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeStatistics.
An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in the analysis period.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DedicatedIp
member.summary: Contains information about a dedicated IP address that is associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DedicatedIp.Ip
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ip.
An IP address that is reserved for use by your Amazon Pinpoint account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DedicatedIp.PoolName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PoolName.
The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated with.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DedicatedIp.WarmupPercentage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WarmupPercentage.
Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is ready for use.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DedicatedIp.WarmupStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WarmupStatus.
The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one of the following values:
IN_PROGRESS – The IP address isn't ready to use because the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.
DONE – The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and the IP address is ready to use.

In Amazon Pinpoint, events include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. Event destinations are places that you can send information about these events to. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.

member.summary:

The date and time when the predictive inbox placement test was created, in Unix time format.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DeliverabilityTestReport.DeliverabilityTestStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeliverabilityTestStatus.
The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is IN_PROGRESS, then the predictive inbox placement test is currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is COMPLETE, then the test is finished, and you can use the GetDeliverabilityTestReport to view the results of the test.

member.summary:

The sender address that you specified for the predictive inbox placement test.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DeliverabilityTestReport.ReportName
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DeliverabilityTestReport.Subject
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DeliveryOptions
member.summary: Used to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DeliveryOptions.TlsPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TlsPolicy.
Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is Require, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is Optional, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Destination

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Destination.BccAddresses
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Destination.CcAddresses
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DkimAttributes
member.summary: An object that contains information about the DKIM configuration for an email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DkimAttributes.SigningEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SigningEnabled.
If the value is true, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. If the value is false, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DkimAttributes.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Describes whether or not Amazon Pinpoint has successfully located the DKIM records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one of the following:
PENDING – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet located the DKIM records in the DNS configuration for the domain, but will continue to attempt to locate them.
SUCCESS – Amazon Pinpoint located the DKIM records in the DNS configuration for the domain and determined that they're correct. Amazon Pinpoint can now send DKIM-signed email from the identity.
FAILED – Amazon Pinpoint was unable to locate the DKIM records in the DNS settings for the domain, and won't continue to search for them.
TEMPORARY_FAILURE – A temporary issue occurred, which prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM status for the domain.
NOT_STARTED – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet started searching for the DKIM records in the DKIM records for the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DkimAttributes.Tokens
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tokens.
A set of unique strings that you use to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration for your domain. When Amazon Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is complete. Amazon Pinpoint usually detects these records within about 72 hours of adding them to the DNS configuration for your domain.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

member.summary:

This value is not the same as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to campaigns that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EmailContent
member.summary: An object that defines the entire content of the email, including the message headers and the body content. You can create a simple email message, in which you specify the subject and the text and HTML versions of the message body. You can also create raw messages, in which you specify a complete MIME-formatted message. Raw messages can include attachments and custom headers.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EmailContent.Raw
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Raw.
The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one blank line.
All of the required header fields must be present in the message.
Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted properly.
If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that Amazon Pinpoint supports.
The entire message must be Base64 encoded.
If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message properly.
The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed 1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in RFC 5321.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EmailContent.Simple
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Simple.
The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a message body.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EmailContent.Template
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Template.
The template to use for the email message.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EventDestination
member.summary: In Amazon Pinpoint, events include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. Event destinations are places that you can send information about these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EventDestination.CloudWatchDestination
member.summary:

An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EventDestination.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Enabled.
If true, the event destination is enabled. When the event destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the destinations in this EventDestinationDefinition.
If false, the event destination is disabled. When the event destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified destinations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EventDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
member.summary:

An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.EventDestination.MatchingEventTypes
member.summary:

The types of events that Amazon Pinpoint sends to the specified event destinations.

member.summary:

A name that identifies the event destination.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetAccount operation. Obtain information about the email-sending status and capabilities of your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountResponse
member.summary: A list of details about the email-sending capabilities of your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountResponse.DedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled.
Indicates whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountResponse.EnforcementStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnforcementStatus.
The reputation status of your Amazon Pinpoint account. The status can be one of the following:
HEALTHY – There are no reputation-related issues that currently impact your account.
PROBATION – We've identified some issues with your Amazon Pinpoint account. We're placing your account under review while you work on correcting these issues.
SHUTDOWN – Your account's ability to send email is currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request that your account's ability to send email is resumed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountResponse.ProductionAccessEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProductionAccessEnabled.
Indicates whether or not your account has production access in the current AWS Region.
If the value is false, then your account is in the sandbox. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200, and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum sending rate) is 1.
If the value is true, then your account has production access. When your account has production access, you can send email to any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your account vary based on your specific use case.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountResponse.SendingEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SendingEnabled.
Indicates whether or not email sending is enabled for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetAccountResponse.SendQuota
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SendQuota.
An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second sending limits for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.

Container for the parameters to the GetConfigurationSetEventDestinations operation. Retrieve a list of event destinations that are associated with a configuration set.
In Amazon Pinpoint, events include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. Event destinations are places that you can send information about these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetConfigurationSetRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetConfigurationSet operation. Get information about an existing configuration set, including the dedicated IP pool that it's associated with, whether or not it's enabled for sending email, and more.
In Amazon Pinpoint, configuration sets are groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions operation. Retrieve information about the status of the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When the Deliverability dashboard is enabled, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see Amazon Pinpoint Pricing.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse
member.summary: An object that shows the status of the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon Pinpoint account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse.AccountStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountStatus.
The current status of your Deliverability dashboard subscription. If this value is PENDING_EXPIRATION, your subscription is scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse.ActiveSubscribedDomains
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActiveSubscribedDomains.
An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send email and currently has an active Deliverability dashboard subscription that isn’t scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse.DashboardEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DashboardEnabled.
Specifies whether the Deliverability dashboard is enabled for your Amazon Pinpoint account. If this value is true, the dashboard is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse.PendingExpirationSubscribedDomains
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PendingExpirationSubscribedDomains.
An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send email and currently has an active Deliverability dashboard subscription that's scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse.SubscriptionExpiryDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubscriptionExpiryDate.
The date, in Unix time format, when your current subscription to the Deliverability dashboard is scheduled to expire, if your subscription is scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month. This value is null if you have an active subscription that isn’t due to expire at the end of the month.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IspPlacements.
An object that describes how the test email was handled by several email providers, including Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo, AOL, and others.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
An object that contains the message that you sent when you performed this predictive inbox placement test.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse.OverallPlacement
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OverallPlacement.
An object that specifies how many test messages that were sent during the predictive inbox placement test were delivered to recipients' inboxes, how many were sent to recipients' spam folders, and how many weren't delivered.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the predictive inbox placement test.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaignRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign operation. Retrieve all the deliverability data for a specific campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is enabled for (PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption operation).

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaignRequest.CampaignId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignId.
The unique identifier for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign. This value is not the same as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to campaigns that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or the Amazon Pinpoint console.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaignResponse
member.summary: An object that contains all the deliverability data for a specific campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is enabled for (PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption operation).

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaignResponse.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.
An object that contains the deliverability data for the campaign.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetDomainStatisticsReport operation. Retrieve inbox placement and engagement rates for the domains that you use to send email.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportRequest.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
The domain that you want to obtain deliverability metrics for.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportRequest.EndDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndDate.
The last day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for. The EndDate that you specify has to be less than or equal to 30 days after the StartDate.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportRequest.StartDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartDate.
The first day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse
member.summary: An object that includes statistics that are related to the domain that you specified.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse.DailyVolumes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DailyVolumes.
An object that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you specified. This object contains data for each day, starting on the StartDate and ending on the EndDate.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse.OverallVolume
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OverallVolume.
An object that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data that was collected from the StartDate to the EndDate.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetEmailIdentity operation. Provides information about a specific identity associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account, including the identity's verification status, its DKIM authentication status, and its custom Mail-From settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityRequest.EmailIdentity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailIdentity.
The email identity that you want to retrieve details for.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse
member.summary: Details about an email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse.DkimAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DkimAttributes.
An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the identity. This object includes the tokens that you use to create the CNAME records that are required to complete the DKIM verification process.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse.FeedbackForwardingStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeedbackForwardingStatus.
The feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
If the value is true, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint sends this notification to the address that you specified in the Return-Path header of the original email.
When you set this value to false, Amazon Pinpoint sends notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur (even if this setting is disabled).

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse.IdentityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityType.
The email identity type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse.MailFromAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MailFromAttributes.
An object that contains information about the Mail-From attributes for the email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetEmailIdentityResponse.VerifiedForSendingStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerifiedForSendingStatus.
Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint, you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For more information about verifying identities, see the Amazon Pinpoint User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.IdentityInfo
member.summary: Information about an email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.IdentityInfo.IdentityName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityName.
The address or domain of the identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.IdentityInfo.IdentityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityType.
The email identity type. The identity type can be one of the following:
EMAIL_ADDRESS – The identity is an email address.
DOMAIN – The identity is a domain.
MANAGED_DOMAIN – The identity is a domain that is managed by AWS.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.IdentityInfo.SendingEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SendingEnabled.
Indicates whether or not you can send email from the identity.
In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you send email from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have to demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon Pinpoint to send email from that identity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
member.summary: An object that contains information about the inbox placement data settings for a verified domain that’s associated with your AWS account. This data is available only if you enabled the Deliverability dashboard for the domain (PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption operation).

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.Global
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Global.
Specifies whether inbox placement data is being tracked for the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.TrackedIsps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrackedIsps.
An array of strings, one for each major email provider that the inbox placement data applies to.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListConfigurationSets operation. List all of the configuration sets associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current region.
In Amazon Pinpoint, configuration sets are groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token returned from a previous call to ListConfigurationSets to indicate the position in the list of configuration sets.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
The number of results to show in a single call to ListConfigurationSets. If the number of results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter, then the response includes a NextToken element, which you can use to obtain additional results.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsResponse
member.summary: A list of configuration sets in your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsResponse.ConfigurationSets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationSets.
An array that contains all of the configuration sets in your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token that indicates that there are additional configuration sets to list. To view additional configuration sets, issue another request to ListConfigurationSets, and pass this token in the NextToken parameter.

For predictive inbox placement tests that are complete, you can use the GetDeliverabilityTestReport operation to view the results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDeliverabilityTestReportsRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
The number of results to show in a single call to ListDeliverabilityTestReports. If the number of results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter, then the response includes a NextToken element, which you can use to obtain additional results.
The value you specify has to be at least 0, and can be no more than 1000.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns operation. Retrieve deliverability data for all the campaigns that used a specific domain to send email during a specified time range. This data is available for a domain only if you enabled the Deliverability dashboard (PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption operation) for the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsRequest.EndDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndDate.
The last day, in Unix time format, that you want to obtain deliverability data for. This value has to be less than or equal to 30 days after the value of the StartDate parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token that’s returned from a previous call to the ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns operation. This token indicates the position of a campaign in the list of campaigns.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
The maximum number of results to include in response to a single call to the ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns operation. If the number of results is larger than the number that you specify in this parameter, the response includes a NextToken element, which you can use to obtain additional results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsRequest.StartDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartDate.
The first day, in Unix time format, that you want to obtain deliverability data for.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsRequest.SubscribedDomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubscribedDomain.
The domain to obtain deliverability data for.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsResponse
member.summary: An array of objects that provide deliverability data for all the campaigns that used a specific domain to send email during a specified time range. This data is available for a domain only if you enabled the Deliverability dashboard (PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption operation) for the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsResponse.DomainDeliverabilityCampaigns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainDeliverabilityCampaigns.
An array of responses, one for each campaign that used the domain to send email during the specified time range.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaignsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token that’s returned from a previous call to the ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns operation. This token indicates the position of the campaign in the list of campaigns.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListTagsForResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListTagsForResource operation. Retrieve a list of the tags (keys and values) that are associated with a specified resource. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with a resource in Amazon Pinpoint. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an optional associated tag value. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListTagsForResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to retrieve tag information for.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListTagsForResource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array that lists all the tags that are associated with the resource. Each tag consists of a required tag key (Key) and an associated tag value (Value)

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.MailFromAttributes
member.summary: A list of attributes that are associated with a MAIL FROM domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.MailFromAttributes.BehaviorOnMxFailure
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BehaviorOnMxFailure.
The action that Amazon Pinpoint to takes if it can't read the required MX record for a custom MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to UseDefaultValue, Amazon Pinpoint uses amazonses.com as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to RejectMessage, Amazon Pinpoint returns a MailFromDomainNotVerified error, and doesn't attempt to deliver the email.
These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain configuration is in the Pending, Failed, and TemporaryFailure states.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.MailFromAttributes.MailFromDomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MailFromDomain.
The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.MailFromAttributes.MailFromDomainStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MailFromDomainStatus.
The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following values:
PENDING – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for the MX record yet.
SUCCESS – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record for the MAIL FROM domain.
FAILED – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX record, or the record no longer exists.
TEMPORARY_FAILURE – A temporary issue occurred, which prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PlacementStatistics.DkimPercentage
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PlacementStatistics.InboxPercentage

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PlacementStatistics.MissingPercentage

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes operation. Enable or disable the automatic warm-up feature for dedicated IP addresses.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesRequest.AutoWarmupEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoWarmupEnabled.
Enables or disables the automatic warm-up feature for dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region. Set to true to enable the automatic warm-up feature, or set to false to disable it.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutAccountSendingAttributesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutAccountSendingAttributes operation. Enable or disable the ability of your account to send email.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutAccountSendingAttributesRequest.SendingEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SendingEnabled.
Enables or disables your account's ability to send email. Set to true to enable email sending, or set to false to disable email sending.
If AWS paused your account's ability to send email, you can't use this operation to resume your account's ability to send email.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutAccountSendingAttributesResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions operation. Associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool. You can use dedicated IP pools to create groups of dedicated IP addresses for sending specific types of email.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsRequest.ConfigurationSetName
member.summary:

The name of the configuration set that you want to associate with a dedicated IP pool.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsRequest.SendingPoolName
member.summary:

The name of the dedicated IP pool that you want to associate with the configuration set.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsRequest.TlsPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TlsPolicy.
Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is Require, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is Optional, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption operation. Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When you enable the Deliverability dashboard, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see Amazon Pinpoint Pricing.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionRequest.DashboardEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DashboardEnabled.
Specifies whether to enable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon Pinpoint account. To enable the dashboard, set this value to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionRequest.SubscribedDomains
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubscribedDomains.
An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send email and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionResponse
member.summary: A response that indicates whether the Deliverability dashboard is enabled for your Amazon Pinpoint account.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes operation. Used to enable or disable DKIM authentication for an email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributesRequest.EmailIdentity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailIdentity.
The email identity that you want to change the DKIM settings for.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributesRequest.SigningEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SigningEnabled.
Sets the DKIM signing configuration for the identity.
When you set this value true, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. When you set this value to false, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributesResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes operation. Used to enable or disable feedback forwarding for an identity. This setting determines what happens when an identity is used to send an email that results in a bounce or complaint event.
When you enable feedback forwarding, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint sends this notification to the address that you specified in the Return-Path header of the original email.
When you disable feedback forwarding, Amazon Pinpoint sends notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon SNS topic. You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur (even if this setting is disabled).

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesRequest.EmailForwardingEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailForwardingEnabled.
Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
If the value is true, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint sends this notification to the address that you specified in the Return-Path header of the original email.
When you set this value to false, Amazon Pinpoint sends notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur (even if this setting is disabled).

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesRequest.EmailIdentity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailIdentity.
The email identity that you want to configure bounce and complaint feedback forwarding for.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes operation. Used to enable or disable the custom Mail-From domain configuration for an email identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesRequest.BehaviorOnMxFailure
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BehaviorOnMxFailure.
The action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the required MX record when you send an email. When you set this value to UseDefaultValue, Amazon Pinpoint uses amazonses.com as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to RejectMessage, Amazon Pinpoint returns a MailFromDomainNotVerified error, and doesn't attempt to deliver the email.
These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain configuration is in the Pending, Failed, and TemporaryFailure states.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesRequest.EmailIdentity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailIdentity.
The verified email identity that you want to set up the custom MAIL FROM domain for.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesRequest.MailFromDomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MailFromDomain.
The custom MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to use. The MAIL FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.
It can't be used to receive email.
It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a destination for feedback forwarding emails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.RawMessage
member.summary: The raw email message.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.RawMessage.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one blank line.
All of the required header fields must be present in the message.
Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted properly.
Attachments must be in a file format that Amazon Pinpoint supports.
The entire message must be Base64 encoded.
If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message properly.
The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed 1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in RFC 5321.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ReputationOptions

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ReputationOptions.LastFreshStart
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastFreshStart.
The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh start.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ReputationOptions.ReputationMetricsEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReputationMetricsEnabled.
If true, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the configuration set. If false, tracking of reputation metrics is disabled for the configuration set.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the SendEmail operation. Sends an email message. You can use the Amazon Pinpoint Email API to send two types of messages:
Simple – A standard email message. When you create this type of message, you specify the sender, the recipient, and the message body, and Amazon Pinpoint assembles the message for you.
Raw – A raw, MIME-formatted email message. When you send this type of email, you have to specify all of the message headers, as well as the message body. You can use this message type to send messages that contain attachments. The message that you specify has to be a valid MIME message.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.ConfigurationSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationSetName.
The name of the configuration set that you want to use when sending the email.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
An object that contains the body of the message. You can send either a Simple message or a Raw message.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.Destination
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Destination.
An object that contains the recipients of the email message.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.EmailTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailTags.
A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using the SendEmail operation. Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish email sending events.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress.
The address that Amazon Pinpoint should send bounce and complaint notifications to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.FromEmailAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FromEmailAddress.
The email address that you want to use as the "From" address for the email. The address that you specify has to be verified.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailRequest.ReplyToAddresses
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplyToAddresses.
The "Reply-to" email addresses for the message. When the recipient replies to the message, each Reply-to address receives the reply.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailResponse
member.summary: A unique message ID that you receive when Amazon Pinpoint accepts an email for sending.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.SendEmailResponse.MessageId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageId.
A unique identifier for the message that is generated when Amazon Pinpoint accepts the message.
It is possible for Amazon Pinpoint to accept a message without sending it. This can happen when the message you're trying to send has an attachment doesn't pass a virus check, or when you send a templated email that contains invalid personalization content, for example.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Tag
member.summary:
An object that defines the tags that are associated with a resource. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with a resource in Amazon Pinpoint. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value, both of which you define. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256 characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following additional restrictions apply to tags:
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it can have only one value.
The aws: prefix is reserved for use by AWS; you can’t use it in any tag keys or values that you define. In addition, you can't edit or remove tag keys or values that use this prefix. Tags that use this prefix don’t count against the limit of 50 tags per resource.
You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the tags are available only for your AWS account, not any other accounts that share the resource. In addition, the tags are available only for resources that are located in the specified AWS Region for your AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Tag.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.Tag.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don’t want a resource to have a specific tag value, don’t specify a value for this parameter. Amazon Pinpoint will set the value to an empty string.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Add one or more tags (keys and values) to a specified resource. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with a resource in Amazon Pinpoint. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value, both of which you define. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.TagResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to add one or more tags to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.TagResourceRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of the tags that you want to add to the resource. A tag consists of a required tag key (Key) and an associated tag value (Value). The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.TrackingOptions
member.summary:
An object that defines the tracking options for a configuration set. When you use Amazon Pinpoint to send an email, it contains an invisible image that's used to track when recipients open your email. If your email contains links, those links are changed slightly in order to track when recipients click them.
These images and links include references to a domain operated by AWS. You can optionally configure Amazon Pinpoint to use a domain that you operate for these images and links.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.TrackingOptions.CustomRedirectDomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomRedirectDomain.
The domain that you want to use for tracking open and click events.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UntagResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UntagResource operation. Remove one or more tags (keys and values) from a specified resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UntagResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove one or more tags from.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UntagResourceRequest.TagKeys
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagKeys.
The tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When you specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its associated tag value.
To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the TagKeys parameter and argument for each additional tag to remove, separated by an ampersand. For example: /v1/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&TagKeys=Key1&TagKeys=Key2

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UntagResourceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UntagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination operation. Update the configuration of an event destination for a configuration set.
In Amazon Pinpoint, events include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. Event destinations are places that you can send information about these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest.ConfigurationSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationSetName.
The name of the configuration set that contains the event destination that you want to modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest.EventDestination
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventDestination.
An object that defines the event destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest.EventDestinationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventDestinationName.
The name of the event destination that you want to modify.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse
member.summary: An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if the request fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing PinpointEmail
Amazon Pinpoint Email Service
Welcome to the Amazon Pinpoint Email API Reference. This guide provides information about the Amazon Pinpoint Email API (version 1.0), including supported operations, data types, parameters, and schemas.
Amazon Pinpoint is an AWS service that you can use to engage with your customers across multiple messaging channels. You can use Amazon Pinpoint to send email, SMS text messages, voice messages, and push notifications. The Amazon Pinpoint Email API provides programmatic access to options that are unique to the email channel and supplement the options provided by the Amazon Pinpoint API.
If you're new to Amazon Pinpoint, you might find it helpful to also review the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide. The Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide provides tutorials, code samples, and procedures that demonstrate how to use Amazon Pinpoint features programmatically and how to integrate Amazon Pinpoint functionality into mobile apps and other types of applications. The guide also provides information about key topics such as Amazon Pinpoint integration with other AWS services and the limits that apply to using the service.
The Amazon Pinpoint Email API is available in several AWS Regions and it provides an endpoint for each of these Regions. For a list of all the Regions and endpoints where the API is currently available, see AWS Service Endpoints in the Amazon Web Services General Reference. To learn more about AWS Regions, see Managing AWS Regions in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
In each Region, AWS maintains multiple Availability Zones. These Availability Zones are physically isolated from each other, but are united by private, low-latency, high-throughput, and highly redundant network connections. These Availability Zones enable us to provide very high levels of availability and redundancy, while also minimizing latency. To learn more about the number of Availability Zones that are available in each Region, see AWS Global Infrastructure.

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.#ctor

Constructs AmazonPinpointEmailClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.CreateConfigurationSet(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetRequest)
member.summary: Create a configuration set. Configuration sets are groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send using Amazon Pinpoint. You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateConfigurationSet service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateConfigurationSet service method, as returned by PinpointEmail.
member.exception: The resource specified in your request already exists.
The input you provided is invalid.
The resource is being modified by another operation or thread.
There are too many instances of the specified resource type.
The resource you attempted to access doesn't exist.
Too many requests have been made to the operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateConfigurationSet Operation

You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest)
member.summary:
Create an event destination. In Amazon Pinpoint, events include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. Event destinations are places that you can send information about these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.
A single configuration set can include more than one event destination.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.CreateDeliverabilityTestReport(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateDeliverabilityTestReportRequest)
member.summary: Create a new predictive inbox placement test. Predictive inbox placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be handled by various email providers around the world. When you perform a predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. Amazon Pinpoint then sends that message to special email addresses spread across several major email providers. After about 24 hours, the test is complete, and you can use the GetDeliverabilityTestReport operation to view the results of the test.

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.CreateEmailIdentity(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.CreateEmailIdentityRequest)
member.summary:
Verifies an email identity for use with Amazon Pinpoint. In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you use when you send email. Before you can use an identity to send email with Amazon Pinpoint, you first have to verify it. By verifying an address, you demonstrate that you're the owner of the address, and that you've given Amazon Pinpoint permission to send email from the address.
When you verify an email address, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email to the address. Your email address is verified as soon as you follow the link in the verification email.
When you verify a domain, this operation provides a set of DKIM tokens, which you can convert into CNAME tokens. You add these CNAME tokens to the DNS configuration for your domain. Your domain is verified when Amazon Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your domain. It usually takes around 72 hours to complete the domain verification process.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateEmailIdentity service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateEmailIdentity service method, as returned by PinpointEmail.
member.exception: The input you provided is invalid.
The resource is being modified by another operation or thread.
There are too many instances of the specified resource type.
Too many requests have been made to the operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateEmailIdentity Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieve information about the status of the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When the Deliverability dashboard is enabled, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see Amazon Pinpoint Pricing.

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.ListConfigurationSets(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.ListConfigurationSetsRequest)
member.summary:
List all of the configuration sets associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current region.
In Amazon Pinpoint, configuration sets are groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListConfigurationSets service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListConfigurationSets service method, as returned by PinpointEmail.

member.name: M:Amazon.PinpointEmail.AmazonPinpointEmailClient.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption(Amazon.PinpointEmail.Model.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionRequest)
member.summary:
Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When you enable the Deliverability dashboard, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see Amazon Pinpoint Pricing.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption service method, as returned by PinpointEmail.
